content: potty little pansy by lettice rose this is the little sister to pot of pansies afghan square make your three-dimensional pansy in whatever colours take your fancy and set it in some dainty foliage size sample is in stylecraft special dk and a 3 5 mm hook producing 4 5 square worsted and a 5 mm hook should come out around 6 the final stitch count is 19 stitches per side potty little pansy copyright 2025 lettice rose colours yarn a - meadow yarn b lavender yarn c lemon yarn d - khaki stitches and abbreviations used 3dccl - three double_crochet cluster 3trcl - three treble_crochet cluster bphdc - back post half_double_crochet bp slip_stitch - back post slip_stitch chain chain double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet pm - place marker single_crochet - single_crochet skip - skip slip_stitch - slip_stitch space - space you will also need six stitch markers and a needle there are some pictures in the text where i think it will help there are further round by round pictures at the end so you do not need to print them unless you want to round 1 using yarn a form a magic_ring and into it work 10 single_crochet join with invisible join finish off 10 single_crochet in round 2 and 3 markers are placed on posts ready for round 4 it will be extremely difficult if you do not do this a scrap of contrast yarn will do the job when you have finished these rounds push the markers through to the wrong side to make them easier to find in round 4 potty little pansy copyright 2025 lettice rose round 2 part 1 we will change colour part way through this round to get the effect of pansy petals using yarn b start in any single_crochet slip_stitch chain 2 2 double_crochet chain 2 slip_stitch all in one stitch side petal formed skip st chain 1 slip_stitch chain 2 2 double_crochet single_crochet 2 double_crochet chain 2 slip_stitch in next st bottom petal made skip st chain 1 slip_stitch chain 2 2 double_crochet chain 2 slip_stitch in next st side petal formed leaving loop on hook cut yarn b with a short 4 tail and leave to weave in later round 2 part 2 using yarn c pull through loop on hook forming chain-1 skip single_crochet slip_stitch chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 2 slip_stitch in next st pm on post of middle double_crochet first upper petal formed skip st chain 1 slip_stitch chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 2 slip_stitch in next st pm on post of the middle double_crochet second upper petal formed slip_stitch in next single_crochet do not finish off 5 petals round 3 the slip stitches go in the skipped single_crochet of round 1 over the round 2 chain-1 and the rest of the stitches go between the stitches of round 2 which gives a nice natural colour change the chain-2 will form the sides of the petals chain 2 2 half_double_crochet in chain-2 space 2 double_crochet
